title: Myanmar quake toll passes 1,600 as people dig for survivors with bare hands
byline: More than 1,600 people have died following the devastating earthquake in Myanmar, with locals in some areas telling the BBC they had been left to dig through rubble for survivors with their bare hands.

title: Kuwait extradites 20 inmates to Sri Lanka
byline: Kuwait has deported 20 convicted Sri Lankan prisoners under an extradition agreement between the two countries, according to media reports. The inmates, held at Kuwait’s Central Prison, were repatriated on Wednesday to Katunayake Airport on a special flight to Sri Lanka, reported the Sri Lankan Daily News.

title: No warrant issued against Eranga Gunasekara, Ministry clarifies
byline: In response to reports claiming that Deputy Minister of Youth Affairs, Eranga Gunasekara, was named as a suspect in the case involving the setting fire to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s private residence, the Ministry has denied the allegation.

title: Suspect who assaulted consultant surgeon, arrested
byline: A suspect has been arrested over the assault on a senior consultant Oral and Maxillofacial (OMF) surgeon at the General Hospital (Teaching) Kegalle.

title: MoUs related to defence, energy connectivity, digitization to be signed during Modi’s visit
byline: A number of MoUs (Memoranda of Understanding) related to defence, energy connectivity and digitization will be signed during the upcoming visit of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to Sri Lanka, an official said yesterday.

title: CID summons former Minister Tiran Alles over Weligama shooting
byline: Former Public Security Minister Tiran Alles has been summoned to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to record a statement regarding the death of a police sergeant from the Colombo Crimes Division during a shooting incident near a hotel in Weligama, Matara in 2023.

title: AWC urges PM Modi to prevent stray dog removal in Anuradhapura
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) of Sri Lanka has reached out to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi urging him to intervene in the planned removal of roaming dogs in Anuradhapura ahead of his scheduled visit to Sri Lanka on April 5, 2025.

title: Eid-ul-Fitr to be celebrated tomorrow
byline: Muslims in Sri Lanka will celebrate Eid-ul-Fitr tomorrow (31) after the crescent moon for Shawwal was sighted today, according to the Colombo Grand Mosque.

title: 7.1 magnitude earthquake hits Tonga, tsunami warning issued
byline: A tsunami warning has been issued following a 7.1 magnitude earthquake that struck near the Pacific island nation of Tonga on Sunday. The earthquake occurred at a depth of 10 kilometers and was reported by the US Geological Survey (USGS).

title: Four arrested for killing Olive Ridley turtles in Negombo
byline: Four individuals who killed Olive Ridley sea turtles and were found in possession of five kilograms of turtle flesh were arrested by Negombo Coastal Conservation Officers, the Department of Wildlife Conservation said.

title: Akila Dananjaya forcing national call-up
byline: Being overlooked amid performances has been the story of his life, but spinner Akila Dananjaya always finds a way to come back stronger.

title: Jaffna–Trichy flight service commences after 47 years
byline: A direct flight service between Tiruchirappalli in Tamil Nadu and Jaffna in Sri Lanka commenced today after 47 years.
